## followed() function

Creates a Parser that applies the given two parsers in sequence, returning the result value of the first at the offset of the second if both succeed. If either parser fails the error is returned as-is.

Equivalent to `then(parser, after, first)`<!-- -->.

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
export declare function followed<T, TAfter>(parser: Parser<T>, after: Parser<TAfter>): Parser<T>;
```

## Parameters

|  Parameter | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  parser | <code>Parser&lt;T&gt;</code> | First parser to apply, value is kept |
|  after | <code>Parser&lt;TAfter&gt;</code> |  |

<b>Returns:</b>

`Parser<T>`
